required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigational Drug Study in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (0431-024)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of the Addition of MK0431 Compared With Sulfonylurea Therapy in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes With Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Monotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this investigational study is to determine the safety and effectiveness of an investigational drug in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (a specific type of diabetes).

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is 104 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as percent. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 52 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as percent. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 104 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 52 is defined as Week 52 minus Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 104 is defined as Week 104 minus Week 0.
Number of participants who reported 1 or more episodes of the adverse experience (AEs) of hypoglycemia.
Number of participants who reported 1 or more episodes of the adverse experience of hypoglycemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinical Adverse Experiences (CAEs) at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse experience (AE) is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious CAEs at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Serious CAEs are any AEs occurring at any dose that; Results in death; or Is life threatening; or Results in a persistent or significant disability/incapacity; or Results in or prolongs an existing inpatient hospitalization; or Is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or Is a cancer; or Is an overdose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Drug-related CAEs at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with drug-related (as assessed by an investigator who is a qualified physician according to his/her best clinical judgment) CAEs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Adverse Experiences (LAEs) at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: A laboratory adverse experience (LAE) is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious LAEs at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Serious LAEs are any LAEs occurring at any dose that: results in death; or is life threatening; or results in a persistent or significant disability/incapacity; or results in or prolongs an existing inpatient hospitalization; or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or is a cancer; or is an overdose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Drug-related LAEs at Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with drug-related (as assessed by an investigator who is a qualified physician according to his/her best clinical judgment) LAEs.

arm_group.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg oral tablets of sitagliptin once daily.
Glipizide 1 tablet (5 mg) per day. Patients could then up-titrated to a total daily dose of 4 tablets twice daily (20mg/day) based on their glycemic control.

intervention.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg oral tablets of sitagliptin once daily.
Glipizide 1 tablet (5 mg) per day. Patients could then up-titrated to a total daily dose of 4 tablets twice daily (20mg/day) based on their glycemic control.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are at least 18 years of age and not older than 78 with type 2 diabetes mellitus

reference.citation: Nauck MA, Meininger G, Sheng D, Terranella L, Stein PP; Sitagliptin Study 024 Group. Efficacy and safety of the dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor, sitagliptin, compared with the sulfonylurea, glipizide, in patients with type 2 diabetes inadequately controlled on metformin alone: a randomized, double-blind, non-inferiority trial. Diabetes Obes Metab. 2007 Mar;9(2):194-205.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase III First Patient In: 26-Oct-2004; Last Patient Last Visit: 17-May-2007; 173 medical clinics worldwide.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants 18-78 years of age with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and inadequate glycemic control (Hemoglobin A1c >6.5% and < 10%) on metformin at a dose of >1500mg/day.

group.title: Sitagliptin 100 mg
group.description: The Sitagliptin 100 mg group includes data from patients randomized to receive treatment with 100 mg oral tablets of sitagliptin once daily.

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: The Glipizide group includes data from patients randomized to receive treatment with glipizide initiated at a dose of 1 tablet (5 mg) per day. Patients could then up-titrated to a total daily dose of 4 tablets twice daily (20mg/day) based on their glycemic control.

participants_list.participants: 4 Participants who Completed Week 52, Did NOT Enter second year
11 Participants who Completed Week 52, Did NOT Enter second year

group.title: Sitagliptin 100 mg
group.description: The Sitagliptin 100 mg group includes data from patients randomized to receive treatment with 100 mg oral tablets of sitagliptin once daily.

group.title: Glipizide
group.description: The Glipizide group includes data from patients randomized to receive treatment with glipizide initiated at a dose of 1 tablet (5 mg) per day. Patients could then up-titrated to a total daily dose of 4 tablets twice daily (20mg/day) based on their glycemic control.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 52
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as percent. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 52 HbA1c percent minus the Week 0 HbA1c percent.
outcome.population: The per protocol population required that a participant had measurements both at baseline and at Week 52, and did not have any major protocol violations (e.g. drug compliance < 75%, addition of prohibited antihyperglycemic agent, incorrect double-blind study medication). No missing data were imputed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight at Week 52
outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 52 is defined as Week 52 minus Week 0.
outcome.population: The All-Patient-as-Treated (APaT) population required that a participant received at least 1 dose of double-blind study therapy. No missing data were imputed.

outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of the double-blind study therapy.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Clinical Adverse Experiences (CAEs) at Week 104
measure.description: An adverse experience (AE) is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the SPONSOR'S product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of the double-blind study therapy.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious CAEs at Week 104
outcome.description: Serious CAEs are any AEs occurring at any dose that; Results in death; or Is life threatening; or Results in a persistent or significant disability/incapacity; or Results in or prolongs an existing inpatient hospitalization; or Is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or Is a cancer; or Is an overdose.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of the double-blind study therapy.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Carcinoid Tumour Of The Small Bowel

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
